taskDescription: Although pyrrole is a much weaker base than most other amines, it is a much stronger acid (pKa ≈ 15 for the pyrrole versus 35 for diethylamine). The N–H hydrogen is readily abstracted by base to yield the pyrrole anion, C4H4N–. Explain.
